hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2736
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "There are six courtesies due from a Muslim to another Muslim: To give Salam to him when he meets him, to accept his invitation when he invites him, to reply to him when he sneezes, to visit him when he is ill, to follow his funeral when he dies, and to love for him what he loves for himself."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2737
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "There are six things due from the believer to another believer: Visiting him when he is ill, attending (his funeral) to him when he dies, accepting his invitation when he invites, giving him Salam when he meets him, replying to him when he sneezes, and wishing him well when he is absent and when he is present."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2738
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Hadrami, the freed slave of the family of Al-Jarud:
hadith_list.english_text: from Nafi: "A man sneezed beside Ibn 'Umar and said: 'Al-Hamdulillah Was-Salamu 'Ala Rasulillah. (All praise is due to Allah, and peace upon the Messenger of Allah)'. So Ibn 'Umar said: 'I too say Al-Hamdulillah Was-Salamu 'Ala Rasulillah, but this is not what the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) taught us. He taught us to say: "Al-Hamdulillah 'Ala Kulli Hal (All praise is due to Allah in every circumstance)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2739
hadith_list.english_text: The Jews used to sneeze in the presence of the Prophet (ﷺ) hoping that he would say: 'Yarhamukumullah (May Allah have mercy upon you).' So he said: 'Yahdikumullahu Wa Yuslihu Balakum (May Allah guide you and rectify your affairs).'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2740
hadith_list.english_text: that he was with some people on a journey, and a man among the people sneezed and he said: "As-Salamu Alaikum (peace be upon you)." So he (Salim) said: "'Alaika Wa 'Ala Ummik (upon you and upon your mother)." It seemed as if that bothered the man, so he said: "Indeed I have not said except what the Prophet (ﷺ) said; a man sneezed in the presence of the Prophet (ﷺ) and said: 'As-Salamu 'Alaikum (peace be upon you)' so the Prophet (ﷺ) said: ''Alaika Wa 'Ala Ummik (upon you and upon your mother). When one of you sneezes let him say: "Al-Hamdulillahi Rabbil-'Alamin (All praise is due to the Lord of all that exists)" and let the one responding to him say: Yarhamukallah (May Allah have mercy upon you)" and let him reply: Yaghfirullah Li Walakum (May Allah forgive me and you both)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2741
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "When one of you sneezes let him say: 'Al-Hamdulillahi 'Ala Kulli Hal (All praise is due to Allah in every circumstance).' And let the one replying to him say: "Yarhamukallah (May Allah have mercy upon you).' And let him say to him: 'Yahdikumullah Wa Yuslihu Balakum (May Allah guide you and rectify your affairs).'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2741b
hadith_list.narrator:
(Another chain) with similar narration.
He [At-Tirmidhi] said:
hadith_list.english_text: This is how Shu'bah reported this Hadith from IbnAbi Laila, and he said: "From Abu  Ayyub from the Prophet (ﷺ)." Ibn Abi Laila was confused in this narration, sometimes he would say: "From Abu Ayyub from the Prophet (ﷺ)" and sometimes he would say: "From 'Ali from the Prophet (ﷺ)" similarly in meaning.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2741c
hadith_list.english_text: (Another chain) from 'Ali from the Prophet (ﷺ) with similar meaning.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2742
hadith_list.english_text: that two men sneezed in the presence of the Prophet (ﷺ); he responded to one of them and did not respond to the other. The one who was not responded to said: "O Messenger of Allah! You responded to this person and did not respond to me?' So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "He praised Allah while you did not praise Him."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2743
hadith_list.english_text: from his father: "A man sneezed in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) while I was present, so the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Yarhamukallah (May Allah have mercy upon you).' Then he sneezed a second and third time. So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "This man is suffering from a cold.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2743b
hadith_list.narrator: (Another chain) from Iyas bin Salamah from his father, from the Prophet (ﷺ) with similar narration, except that he said to him the third time:
hadith_list.english_text:
"You are suffering from a cold."
[He said:] And this is more correct than the narration of Ibn Al-Mubarak.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2743c
hadith_list.english_text: Shu'bah reported this Hadith from 'Ikrimah bin 'Ammar and it is similar to the narration of Yahya bin Sa'eed. (A chain to support that).

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2743d
hadith_list.narrator: And 'Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi reported it from 'Ikrimah bin 'Ammar and it is similar to the narration of Ibn Al-Mubarak, but he said to him the third time:
hadith_list.english_text: "You are suffering from a cold." (A chain to support that)

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2744
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated 'Umar bin Ishaq bin Abi Talhah:
hadith_list.english_text: from his mother, from her father, who said: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Reply three times to the sneezing person. If he (sneezes) more, then if you wish reply and if you do not then do not.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2745
hadith_list.english_text: that when the Prophet (ﷺ) would sneeze, he would cover his face with his hand or with his garment, and muffle the sound with it.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2746
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "The sneeze is from Allah and the yawn is from Ash-Shaitan. So when one of you yawns let him cover his mouth with his hand. For when he says 'Ah, Ah' Ash-Shaitan laughs from inside his opening." [And indeed Allah loves the sneeze and He dislikes the Yawn, so when a man says Ah, Ah when yawning, indeed Ash-Shaitan laughs from inside his opening."]

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2747
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Indeed Allah loves sneezing and He dislikes the yawn. So when one of you sneezes and says 'Al-Hamdulillah (All praise is due to Allah),' then it is a right due from every one who hears him to say: 'Yarhamukallah (May Allah have mercy upon you)' As for yawning then when one of you yawns let him suppress it as much as possible and not say: "Hah Hah' for that is only from Ash-Shaitan laughing at him."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2748
hadith_list.english_text: from 'Adi - and he is Ibn Thabit - from his father, from his grandfather - [from the Prophet (ﷺ)]: "Sneezing, dozing and yawning during Salat, and menstruation, regurgitation and nosebleeds are from Ash-Shaitan."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2749
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Let one of you not have his brother stand from his seat then sit in it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2750
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Let one of you not have his brother stand from his seat then sit in it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2751
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "A man has more right to his seat. If he leaves for some need of his, then he returns, then he has more right to his seat."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2752
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "It is not lawful for a man to separate two people except with their permission."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2753
hadith_list.english_text: that a man sat in the middle of a circle so Hudhaifah said: "Cursed upon the tongue of Muhammad - or - Cursed, by Allah upon the tongue of Muhammad (ﷺ), is he who sits in the middle of a the circle."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2754
hadith_list.english_text: "There was no person more beloved to them than the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)." [He said:] "And they would not stand when they saw him because they knew that he disliked that."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2755
hadith_list.english_text: that Mu'awiyah came out and 'Abdullah bin Az-Zubair and Ibn Safwan stood for him when they saw him, so he said: "Sit, I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'Whoever wishes that he be received by men standing then, let him take his seat in the Fire.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2756
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Five are from the Fitrah: Cutting the pubic hair, circumcision, paring the mustache, plucking the under arm hair and trimming the fingernails."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2757
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Ten are from the Fitrah: Paring the mustache, leaving the beard to grow, Siwak, cleaning the nose with water, paring the fingernails, washing the knuckles, plucking the underarm hair, shaving the pubic hairs, and Intiqas with water."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2758
hadith_list.english_text: from the Prophet (ﷺ), that he (ﷺ) fixed the time as every forty nights for them to trimming the fingernails, taking from the mustache, and shaving the pubic hairs.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2759
hadith_list.english_text: "[The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)] fixed the time for us paring the mustache, trimming the fingernails, shaving the pubic hairs and plucking the underarm hairs - that we not leave it for more than forty days."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2760
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet (ﷺ) would pare, or take from his mustache, and Ibrahim Khalilur-Rahman would do it (as well)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2761
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever does not take from his mustache, then he is not from us."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2762
hadith_list.english_text: from his father, from his grandfather that he Prophet (ﷺ) would take from his beard; from its breadth and its length.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2763
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Trim the mustache and leave the beard to grow."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2764
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ordered trimming the mustache and leaving the beard to grow.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2765
hadith_list.english_text: from his paternal uncle, that he saw the Prophet (ﷺ) reclining in the Masjid, and placing one of his feet atop another.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2766
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited Ishtimal As-Samma, Al-Ihtiba in one garment, and that a man raise one of his feet atop the other while he is reclining on his back."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2767
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited Ishtimal As-Samma, Al-Ihtiba in one garment, and that a man raise one of his feet atop the other while he is reclining on his back."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2768
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saw a man laying on his stomach so he said: "Indeed such laying is not loved by Allah."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2769
hadith_list.english_text: "My father narrated to me from my grandfather, who said: 'I said: "O Messenger of Allah! Regarding our 'Awrah, what of it must we cover and what of it may we leave?" He said: "Protect your 'Awrah except from your wife or what your right hand possesses."' He said: "What about a man with another man?" He said: "If you are able to not let anyone see it, then do so." I said: "What about a man when he is alone?" He said: "Allah is most deserving of being shy from Him."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2770
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) reclining upon as pillow, on his left side."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2771
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) reclining upon a pillow."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2772
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "A man is not lead in his dominion, and his seat of honor in his house is not sat in without his permission."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2773
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard my father Buraidah saying: 'I was walking with the Prophet (ﷺ) when a man came to him with a donkey, so he said: "O Messenger of Allah! Ride" and the man moved toward the back. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "No, you have more right to the front of your beast, unless you allot it for me." He said: "I have allotted it for you.'" He said: 'So he rode.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2774
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Do you have Anmat?" I said: "Where would we get Anmat from?" He said: "Soon you will have Anmat" He said: "I would say to my wife: 'Remove your Anmat from my sight.' But she would say: 'Did not the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say: "Indeed you shall soon have Anmat?" He said: "So I left it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2775
hadith_list.english_text: from his father who said: "I guided Allah's Prophet (ﷺ) and Al-Hasan and Al-Husain, on his gray mule until I brought him to the apartment of the Prophet (ﷺ), this one was in front of him, and this one behind him."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2776
hadith_list.english_text: "I asked the Messenger Of Allah (ﷺ) about the unintentional glance, so he ordered me that I divert my sight."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2777
hadith_list.english_text: from his father (from the Prophet (ﷺ)) who said: "O 'Ali! Do not follow a look with a look, the first is for you, but the next is not for you."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2778
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Nabhan the freed slave of Umm Salamah:
hadith_list.english_text: to Ibn Shihab, that Umm Salamah narrated to him, that she and Maimunah were with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), she said: "So when we were with him, Ibn Umm Maktum came, and he entered upon him, and that was after veiling had been ordered for us. So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Veil yourselves from him.' So I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Is he not blind such that he can not see us or recognize us?' So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Are you two blind such that you can not see him?'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2779
hadith_list.english_text: from the freed slave of 'Amr bin Al-'As that 'Amr bin Al-'As sent him to 'Ali seeking his permission to enter upon Asma bint Umais, so he permitted him. When he was finished from what he needed, the freed slave of 'Amr bin Al-'As asked about that, so he said: "Indeed the Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited us - or - prohibited that we enter upon women, without the permission of their husbands."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2780
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Usamah bin Zaid, and Sa'eed bin Zaid bin 'Amr bin Nufail:
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "I have not left among the people after me, a Fitnah more harmful upon men than women."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2780b
hadith_list.english_text: Another chain with a similar narration

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2781
hadith_list.english_text: that he heard Mu'awiyah giving a Khutbah in Al-Madinah, and saying: "Where are your scholars, O people of Al-Madinah? [Indeed] I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbidding from these locks (of hair), and saying: 'The Children of Isra'il were only ruined when their women used them.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2782
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) cursed the women who practice tattooing and those who seek to be tattooed, the women who remove hair from their faces seeking beautification by changing the creation of Allah.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2783
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Allah's curse is upon the woman who lengthens hair and the women who seeks to have her hair lengthened, and the woman who tattoos and the woman who seeks to have her herself tattooed."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2783b
hadith_list.english_text: (Another chain) with a similar narration

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2784
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cursed the women who imitate men and the men who imitate women."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2785
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cursed those men who behave effeminately and those women whose behavior is masculine."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2786
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Every eye commits adultery, and when the woman uses perfume and she passes by a gathering, then she is like this and that.'" Meaning an adulteress.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2787
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Fragrance for men is that which its scent is apparent and its color is hidden, and fragrance for women is that which its color is visible and its scent is hidden." (Meaning when leaving the home as indicated by the previous chapter. As far as in the presence of the husband, then the woman may wear fragrant perfume.)

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2887b
hadith_list.english_text: Another chain of narration similar in meaning.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2788
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet (ﷺ) said [to me]: 'Indeed the best fragrance for men is what's scent is apparent and its color is hidden, and the best fragrance for women is what's color is visible and its scent is hidden.' And he prohibited Mitharatil-Urjawan (Mitharah was some type of saddle cloth. Some of the people of knowledge say it was a certain kind of cloth made of silk, and it preceded earlier under no. 1760. They disagree over Al-Urjawan, and perhaps it means whatever is red, meaning the Red Mitahrah, see Tuhfat Al-Ahwadhi)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2789
hadith_list.english_text: "Anas would not refuse perfume, and Anas said: 'Indeed the Prophet (ﷺ) would not refuse perfume."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2790
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "There are three that are not refused: Cushions, oils [Duhn (fragrance)], and milk."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2791
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'When one of you is given some fragrance then do not refuse it, for indeed it comes from Paradise."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2792
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "A woman is not to touch a woman such that she can describe her to her husband as if he is looking at her."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2793
hadith_list.narrator:
Narrated 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Sa'eed [Al-Khudri]
from his father who said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'A man is not to look at the 'Awrah of a man, and a woman is not to look at the 'Awrah of a woman. A man is not to be alone with a man under one garment, and a woman is not to be alone with a woman under one garment.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2794
hadith_list.english_text: from his father, from his grandfather, who said: "I said: 'O Prophet of Allah! Regarding our 'Awrah, what of it must we cover and what of it may we leave?' He said: 'Protect your 'Awrah except from your wife or what your right hand possesses.' He said: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! What about when some people are with others?' He said: 'If you are able to not let anyone see it then do not let them see it.'" He said: "I said: 'O Prophet of Allah! What about when one of us is alone?' He said: 'Allah is more deserving of being shy from Him than the people.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2795
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Zur'ah bin Muslim bin Jardah Al-Aslami:
hadith_list.english_text: about his grandfather Jarhad, he said: "The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by Jarhad in the Masjid and his thigh was exposed, so he said: 'Indeed the thigh is 'Awrah.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2796
hadith_list.english_text: from his father, from the Prophet (ﷺ) who said: "The thigh is 'Awrah."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2797
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The thigh is 'Awrah."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2798
hadith_list.english_text: "Ibn Jarhad informed me from his father, that the Prophet (ﷺ) passed by him while his thigh was exposed, so the Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Cover your thigh, for indeed it is 'Awrah.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2799
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard Sa'eed bin Musayyab saying: 'Indeed Allah is Tayyib (good) and he loves Tayyib (what is good), and He is Nazif (clean) and He loves cleanliness, He is Karim (kind) and He loves kindness, He is Jawad (generous) and He loves generosity. So clean' - I think he said - 'your courtyards, and do not resemble the Jews.'" He said: "I mentioned that to Muhajir bin Mismar, and he said: "Amir bin Sa'd [bin Abi Waqqas] narrated it to me from his father from the Prophet (ﷺ), similarly, except that he did not say: "Clean your courtyards."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2800
hadith_list.english_text: from Laith, from Nafi, from Ibn 'Umar that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Beware of nakedness! For indeed there are with you, those who do not part from you except at the place of defecation, and when a man goes into his wife. So be shy of them and honor them."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2801
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, then he is not to let his wife enter the Hammam, and whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, then he is not to enter the Hammam without an Izar. And whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, then he is not to sit at a spread in which Khamr is circulated."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2802
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Abu 'Udhrah [and he lived during the time of the Prophet (ﷺ)]:
hadith_list.english_text: from 'Aishah, that the Prophet (ﷺ) prohibitied the men and women from the Hammamat (plural of Hammam), then he permitted it for the men in Izar."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2803
hadith_list.english_text: that some women from the inhabitants of Hims, or from the inhabitants of Ash-Sham entered upon 'Aishah, so she said: "Are you those whose women enter the Hammamat? I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'No woman removes her garments in other than the house of her husband except that she has torn the screen between herself and her Lord.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2804
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard Abu Talhah saying: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: "The angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or an object of images."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2805
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Ishaq bin 'Abdullah bin Abi Talhah:
hadith_list.english_text: that Rafi' bin Ishaq informed him, saying: "I and 'Abdullah bin Abi Talhah entered upon Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri to visit him. So Abu Sa'eed said: 'The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) informed us: "The angels do not enter a house in which there is an image or a picture."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2806
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Jibra'il came to me and said: "Indeed I had come to you last night, and nothing prevented me from entering upon you at the house you were in, except that there were images of men at the door of the house, and there was a curtain screen with imagines on it, and there was a dog in the house. So go and sever the head of the image that is at the door so that it will become like a tree stump, and go and cut the screen and make two throw-cushions to be sat upon, and go and expel the dog." So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did so, and the dog was a puppy belonging to Al-Husain or Al-Hasan which was under his belongings, so he ordered him to expel it.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2807
hadith_list.english_text: "A man passed by while wearing two red garments. He gave Salam to the Prophet (ﷺ) but he did not return the Salam."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2808
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited the gold ring, Al-Qassi, Al-Mitharah, and Al-Ji'ah (beer)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2809
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ordered us with seven things and he forbade us from seven. He ordered us to follow the funeral, visit the ill, reply to the sneezing person, accept the invitation, assist the oppressed, to help the one who made an oath, and to return the Salam. And he forbade us from seven things: From the gold ring, or ringlets of gold, silver vessels, wearing silk, Ad-Dibaj, Al-Istabraq, And Al-Qassi."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2810
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Wear white, for indeed it is very pure and cleaner, and shroud your dead in it.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2811
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) on a clear night, so I looked at the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and at the moon, and he was wearing a red Hullah, and he looked better than the moon to me."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2811b
hadith_list.narrator: Shu'bah and Ath-Thawri reported it from Abu Ishaq from Al-Bara bin 'Azib who said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw a red Hullah on the Messenger of Allah." (Another chain of narration.)

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2812
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw the Messenger of Allah wearing two green Burud."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2813
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) went out during the morning wearing a Mirt made of black hair."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2814
hadith_list.english_text: that his grandmothers Safiyyah bint 'Ulaibah and Dhuhaibah bint 'Ulaibah narrated to him, from Qailah bint Makhramah - and they were her wet nurses and Qailah was the grandmother of their father - his mother's mother - she said: "We came to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)" and she mentioned the Hadith in its entirety; "until a man came when the sun had rose up, so he said: "As-Salamu 'Alaika O Messenger of Allah!' So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Wa 'Alaikas-Salamu Wa Rahmatullah' and upon him - meaning the Prophet (ﷺ) - were two tattered cloths, which had been dyed with saffron and had faded, and he had a small date-palm branch with him."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2815, 2815b
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited saffron for men.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2816
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a man wearing Khuluq and said: 'Go and wash it, then wash it, then do not use it again.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2817
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated The freed slave of Asma:
hadith_list.english_text: from Ibn 'Umar who said: "I heard 'Umar mentioning that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Whoever wears silk in the world he shall not wear it in the Hereafter.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2818
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) distributed some cloaks but he did not give anything to Makhramah. Makhramah said: 'O my son! Let us go to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).' So I went with him. He said: 'Enter and call him for me.'So I called the Prophet (ﷺ) for him, then the Prophet (ﷺ) came out wearing one of the cloaks. He (ﷺ) said: 'I kept this one for you.'" He said: "So he looked at him and said: 'Makhramah is pleased.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2819
hadith_list.english_text: from his father, from his grandfather who said: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Indeed Allah loves to see the results of his favors upon His Slaves.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2820
hadith_list.english_text: from his father: "An-Najashi gave the Prophet (ﷺ) two black plain Khuff. So he wore them, then he performed Wudu and wiped over them."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2821
hadith_list.english_text: from his father, from his grandfather: "The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited plucking gray hair. And he said: "It is the Muslim's light.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2822
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "The one whose counsel is sought is entrusted."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2823
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'The one whose council is sought is entrusted.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2824, 2824b, 2824c, 2824d
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Salim and Hamzah, the sons of 'Abdullah bin 'Umar:
hadith_list.english_text: from their father that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "An omen is in three: A woman, a dwelling, and a (riding) beast."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2825
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whenever there are three of you, then let two not converse in exclusion of their companion."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2826
hadith_list.english_text: that Abu Juhaifah said: "I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) (he was) white and turning grey. Al-Hasan bin 'Ali resembles him most. He had promised thirteen young she-camels for us, so we went to get them. When we arrived he had died without giving us anything. So when Abu Bakr (became the Khalifah) he said: 'If there is anyone to whom the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) made a promise, then let him come forth.' I stood to inform him about it, and he ordered that they be given to us."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2827
hadith_list.english_text: that Abu Juhaifah said: "I saw the Prophet (ﷺ), and Al-Hasan bin 'Ali resembles him the most."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2828
hadith_list.english_text: "I did not hear the Prophet (ﷺ) mentioning both of his parents (that is including both in the saying "May my father and mother be ransomed for you") for anyone other than Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2829
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did not mention both of his parents for anyone except Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas. On the Day of Uhud he said: 'Shoot, may my father and mother be ransomed for you.' And he said to him: 'Shoot! O young man.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2830
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) mentioned both of his parents to me on the Day of Uhud."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2831
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said to him: "O my little son."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2832
hadith_list.english_text: from his father, from his grandfather that the Prophet (ﷺ) ordered naming the child on the seventh day, removing the harm from him, and Al-'Aqq (removing the hair and slaughtering the animal for 'Aqiqah).

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2833
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The most loved names to Allah are 'Abdullah and 'Abdur-Rahman."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2834
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The most loved names to Allah are 'Abdullah and 'Abdur-Rahman."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2835
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "I forbid naming with Rafi, Barakah and Yasar."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2836
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Do not name your boy Rabah, nor Aflah, nor Yasar, nor Najih, so that it may be said: 'Is he there?' and it may be said: 'No.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2837
hadith_list.english_text: that Abu Hurairah conveyed to him that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The most despicable (Akhna) name to Allah on the Day of Judgement is that of a man named King of Kings. (Malikil-Amlak)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2838
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) changed the name of 'Asiyah, he said: "You are Jamilah."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2839
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) would change abhorrent names."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2840
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Muhammad bin Jubair bin Mut'im:
hadith_list.english_text: from his father that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "I have some names: I am Muhammad, I am Ahmad, I am Al-Mahi, the one by whom Allah wipes out disbelief, I am Al-Hasir, the one whom the people are gathered at his feet, and I am Al-'Aqib, the one after whom there is no Prophet."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2841
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited that one use his name and his Kunyah; naming themselves Muhammad Abul-Qasim.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2842
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ): "When you name yourself after me, then do not use my Kunyah."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2843
hadith_list.english_text: that he said: "O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)! If I have a son after you do you think I could name him your Kunyah?" He said: "Yes." So he said: "So that was permitted for me."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2844
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Indeed some poetry is wisdom"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2845
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Indeed some poetry is wisdom".

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2846
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had a Minbar placed in the Masjid for Hassan to stand to boast (poetically) about the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)" - or she said: "to defend the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). And the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Indeed Allah has aided Hassan with the holy spirit (Jibril) as he boasts about - or - defends the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2846b
hadith_list.english_text: (Another chain) from 'Aishah with the same narration.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2847
hadith_list.english_text:
that the Prophet (ﷺ) entered Makkah during 'Umratil-Qada and 'Abdullah bin Rawahah was walking in front of him reciting verses of poetry.
"O tribes of disbelievers get out of his way - today we will strike you about its revelation; a strike that removes the heads from the shoulders - and makes the friend not concerned about his friend."
'Umar said to him: "O Ibn Rawahah! Before the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), and in the sanctuary of Allah you utter poetry?" the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Leave him O 'Umar! For it is quicker upon them than the raining arrow."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2848
hadith_list.english_text: from his father, that 'Aishah was asked: "Did the Prophet (ﷺ) used to say any poetry?" She said: "He would say parables with the poetry of Ibn Rawahah, saying: 'News shall come to you from where you did not expect it.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2849
hadith_list.english_text: that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The best statement spoken by the Arab is the saying of Labid: 'Everything aside from Allah perishes.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2850
hadith_list.english_text: "I sat with the Prophet (ﷺ) more than one-hundred times. His Companions used to recite poetry and talk about things that occurred during Jahiliyyah, and he would remain silent, and sometimes he would smile along with them."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2852
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "It is better that one of you fill his insides with puss than to fill it with poetry."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2851
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Muhammad bin Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas:
hadith_list.english_text: from his father that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "It is better that one of you fill his insides with puss than to fill it with poetry."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2853
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Indeed Allah detests the excessive among men, who slaps his tongue around like the cow slaps his tongue."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2854
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited that a man sleep on a terrace without something to obstruct him (so that he will not roll off and fall)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2855
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to take care of us by preaching during the days fearing that we may get bored."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 3093
hadith_list.english_text: (Another chain) with similar meaning.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2856
hadith_list.english_text: "I asked 'Aishah and Umm Salamah about which deed did the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) like to do most. They said: 'Whatever he could do regularly, even if it was little.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2856b
hadith_list.narrator: It has been reported from Hisham bin 'Urwah from his father, that 'Aishah said:
hadith_list.english_text:
"The most loved deed to the Messenger
of Allah (ﷺ) was what he could do regularly."

(Another chain) with similar meaning.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2857
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Cover the vessels, tie the water-skins, close the doors, extinguish the torches, for indeed the mischief-makers (vermin) may drag away the wick, causing a fire for the inhabitants of the house."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2858
hadith_list.english_text: that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "When you travel through fertile land, then give the camels their fill of the land, and when you travel through drought, then hasten while they are fresh, and when you camp late, then stay away from the road, for indeed it is the route of the beasts and the abode of poisonous vermin in the night."
